deck: Father of Jaime Reyes, the third and current Blue Beetle.
description:
He was born in Arroyo Blanco, Mexico but his family moved to America when he was just a baby. He decided to follow in his father footsteps and joined the military but has retired and is now a mechanic in El Paso and is a regular supporting cast member in Blue Beetle. He is married to Bianca Reyes and is father to Jaime and Milagro Reyes.

Major Story Arcs

Shellshocked

For more information see: Shellshocked

Berto runs Reyes Gas and Service station with his one employee Luis. Jamie is always hounding Berto to let him help out but Berto is firm that Jamie needs to ace high school first. Then Jamie goes missing for a year, and in that time some thugs come looking for Luis and Berto is beaten up and from then on has to walk with a cane.

A year after his disappearance Jamie returns home and show Berto and the family that he is now the Blue Beetle. Bianca and Milagro take it badly and run off. Berto stays behind and explains to Jamie that Milagro is scared and Bianca is torn because she has already come to terms that Jamie was dead. Berto then tells his son to go somewhere while Berto talks to the family.

Road Trip

For more information see: Road Trip

deck: Superhero groupie and member of the Seven Soldiers of Victory
description:
This article is about the Modern Age wannabe hero. For the similarly-named Golden Age hero, see Dan the Dyna-Mite.

Origin

A superhero groupie, Harris Ledbetter purchased counterfeit versions of Dyna-Mite's rings from Cassandra Craft. Using these to become Dyno-Mite Dan, he answered an ad placed by Vigilante and became a member of the new Seven Soldiers of Victory.

Creation

Dyno-Mite Dan was created by Grant Morrison and JH Williams III. He made his first appearance in Seven Soldiers #0.

Major Story Arcs

Seven Soldiers of Victory

Dan joins the rest of the Seven Soldiers in hunting a giant spider in Arizona. During the confrontation with the spider he activates his rings, but freezes up in the face of the battle. He is killed along with all the other members of the Seven Soldiers when the Sheeda appear and begin the harrowing.

Powers and Abilities

Dan has no known superhuman powers or abilities.

Weapons and Equipment

Dan possesses two "working fakes" of a set of rings which, when activated, turn the wearer into a living reactor.
name: Dyno-Mite Dan

deck: Amalgam version of the Vulture and Black Condor
description:
Black Vulture is the Amalgam version of DC's Black Condor and Marvel's Vulture. 
 
Black Vulture is a member of the Sinister Society. It is unknown if Black Vulture is a cyborg, robot or is wearing a power suit. It is assumed he is mostly mechanical, being an enemy of Will Magnus who many of the Sinister Society blame for their current appearances. He is composed of Ninth Metal. 
 
He later joined forces with Magneto and the Magnetic Men against Magnus.

He is made entirely out of adamantium. Kultron is a member of the Sinister Society and later joined forces with Magneto and the Magnetic Men.

Vance Cosmic is a member of the Sinister Society and is composed of Inerton, a super tough metallic substance. He was sent along with his comrades in an attempt to capture the Magnetic Men in order to learn their secrets in order to become human again.
 
The Society was defeated though, but soon joined forces with the Magnetic Men because of their shared enemy, Will Magnus.

Quasimodox is the Amalgam version of Marvel's Quasimodo and DC's Vril Dox II.
 
He is one of the leaders of the Sinister Society. The society was able to capture the Magnetic Men as they tried to live normal human lives. Magneto arrived to save his friends and easily defeated the Society. It was then revealed that all Quasimodox wanted was to turn human once again, having been changed by Will Magnus.
 
Realizing they had a common enemy in Magnus, the Society joined forces with Magneto.
name: Quasimodox

deck: Archer and mercenary, son of the original Alias the Spider
description:
This article is about the second Ludlow to take on the identity of the Spider. For the first, see Thomas Ludlow Hallaway. For the third, see Thomas Ludlow-Dalt.

Origin

The son of the original Alias the Spider and a reporter, Lucas was born after his father was killed by the Shade. He took up his criminal father's identity and career when he reached adulthood.

Creation

Lucas Ludlow-Dalt was created by James Robinson and Peter Snejbjerg. He made his first appearance in Starman #47.

Major Story Arcs

Grand Guignol

Lucas is recruited by Simon Culp as part of his plan to get revenge on the Shade. He is sent to kill an informant, and later helps to capture Mikaal Tomas and cause chaos in Opal City. He is set to guard the Shade after he has been subdued and stripped of his powers. He attempts to kill the Shade, but is prevented by Matt O'Dare. He manages to shoot O'Dare in the shoulder and flees, successfully escaping.

Slings and Arrows

Impersonating Green Arrow in order to frame the hero, Lucas carries out a series of assassinations in Louisiana in order to remove all other claimants on a lucrative land deal. He successfully kills all but two of the investors before he is confronted by Green Arrow, Hawkgirl, and Hawkman. Though he initially has the upper hand, he is soon overwhelmed by the heroes, and shot in the eye by Green Arrow. He escapes, and despite losing his vision in one eye remains a prodigious shot.

Seven Soldiers of Victory

Living in much reduced circumstances, Lucas is assassinated by his younger brother, Tom, who takes the alias of the Spider for himself.

Powers and Abilities

Lucas has no known superhuman powers or abilities. He is skilled with the bow and arrow, and has excellent aim. He has good reflexes, and is a competent hand-to-hand combatant.

Weapons and Equipment

Lucas carries a bow and quiver full of arrows. He occasionally uses trick arrows, notably arrows which trail a spider web-like netting.

deck: A runaway who was rescued by the Black Widow, and caught up in her web of espionage.
description:
Sally Anne Carter ran away from home at the age of fifteen. This was due to the fact that her stepfather was sexually abusing her and her mother did not believe her. When Sally's mother confronted him, he claimed that she was probably just having bad dreams. 
 
Sally hitchhiked and was picked up by two truckers willing to give her a left. When they stopped Sally tried to escape when the two truckers tried to have their way with her. This brought about the attention of the Natasha Romanova aka  Black Widow and Phil Dexter, who were the on the trail of KGB agents and North Organization who were killing former Black Widows. Natasha rescued the girl and had her tag along while she tracked down the rogues. Sally joined the duo and began to form a brother and sister relationship with Phil. And also formed a maternal bond with Natasha. 
 
Soon, however, the North agents Max Hunter and Kestrel caught up with the Widow and attacked both Phil and Sally Anne. Phil was nearly killed and Sally Anne was missing. The Widow took her for dead. 
 
It was later revealed that Sally Anne had indeed survived but was in critical condition. Her captors had taken her to a shady doctor who patched her up. When Natasha discovered this she went on a non stop mission to find her. She killed many and blackmailed the mob into finding Sally Anne. Sally Anne's captors had taken her to the Cutting Corporation in Cuba, where they kidnapped and drugged women to build dolls. She became close with another girl there named Marciela, who informed her of the heinous acts that happened there. Natasha soon rescued Sally but was in turn captured. Sally alone in the woods was found by Yelena Belova(who had taken up residence and a heiress lifestyle in Cuba) and Daredevil. Yelena sent Sally Anne back into the facility under the impression Kestrel(who was holding the Widow prisoner) had captured her. Yelena and Daredevil snuck into the facility behind Carter and followed her until learning where Widow and the other prisoners were held. They freed Natasha and explained how they located her. This helped free the hundreds of girls used as human guinea pigs by the Corporation. She captured twelve of the personnel involved in the experiments. Natasha convinced Yelena to evacuate the girls to somewhere safe. Yelena complied but had Nat and Sally Anne recuperate at her mansion until regaining their strength.

deck: Freelance agent of the North Organization who was an enemy of the Black Widow
description: Kestrel was a freelance agent hired to kill Black Widow along with her partner Max Hunter. She is also a lesbian. After Kestrel and Max severely injure one of the Widow's companions and kidnaps the other, she swears revenge. In retribution she kills Max and publicly humiliates Kestrel, leaving her tied up with her lesbian lover for the police and paparazzi to find. Kestrel deeply affected by the death of her partner whom she considered family after he took a bullet for her swore revenge upon the Black Widow. She teams up with Martin ferris, a man whom the Widow had "wronged" in hopes to kill her. They used Natasha's ward Sally Anne Carter as bait and captured her. They beat her but waited before delivering the killing her, wanting her to suffer. However the intervention of Yelena Belova and Daredevil prevented them from completing their task. They attempted to flee, but the Black Widow caught up and killed them both.

deck: Amalgam version of Rocky Davis and Thing
description:
Rocky is the Amalgam version of DC's Rocky Davis and Marvel's Thing. 
 
Rocky is a United States senator. He accompanied Reed 'Prof' Richards and Sue 'Ace' Storm on a experimental space flight. The rocked was sabotaged and crashed to Earth. Miraculously, they all survived and came to be known as the Challengers of the Fantastic.
 


In battle with Galactiac, Rocky was attacked by the nearly omnipotent being and transformed into the Four Armed-Thing and turned on his friends. After Galactiac's defeat, Rocky asked Prof to find a way for him to transform back into the creature.
name: Rocky

volume_credits.name: Return to the Amalgam Age of Comics: The Marvel Comics Collection

deck: Amalgam version of Red Ryan and Human Torch
description:
Red is the Amalgam version of DC's Red Ryan and Marvel's Human Torch.
 
Johnny is the younger brother of Sue 'Ace' Storm and a daredevil. He was allowed to go on an experimental test flight with his sister along with Reed 'Prof' Richards and Ben 'Rocky' Grimm. The rocket was sabotaged and crashed but all survived. From that day forth they became the Challengers of the Fantastic. Johnny carries a flamethrower as a weapon. 
 
Johnny is in love with Dream Crystal, one of the Un-People. She was taken from Johnny by their leader Vykin the Black Bolt, who forbid the union.
 
Johnny has what he calls 'stormtrooper clones,' tiny clones of himself that think as he does. One of these clones was used in the defeat of Galactiac, Johnny controlling the clone with the help of Uatu the Guardian. The clone died from the effort.
name: Red

volume_credits.name: Return to the Amalgam Age of Comics: The Marvel Comics Collection

deck: Amalgam version of Prof Haley and Reed Richards
description:
Prof is the Amalgam version of DC's Prof Haley and Marvel's Mister Fantastic. 
 
Reed is a genius and uses his knowledge for the benefit of human kind. While testing an experimental rocket to see if it could make manned spaceflight safe from cosmic mutations, he was betrayed by his partner Victor Von Doom. The spacecraft crashed to Earth, but all survived. From this day forth they were known as the Challengers of the Fantastic.  
 
In battle with Galactiac, Reed used Doctor Octavius' anima-tentacles. He has also sworn to find a way to turn Rocky back into the Four-Armed Thing.
name: Prof

volume_credits.name: Return to the Amalgam Age of Comics: The Marvel Comics Collection

deck: Amalgam version of Ace Morgan and the Invisible Woman.
description:
Ace is the Amalgam version of DC's Ace Morgan and Marvel's Invisible Woman. 
 
Ace is a fearless agent of SHIELD. She participated in a experimental test flight with Reed 'Prof' Richards. The craft was sabotaged and crashed to Earth. Having all survived, the banned together as the Challengers of the Fantastic. She is equipped with many weapons and a force field generator.
 
Like the Marvel version, Ace is torn between wanting Prof or Mariner as a companion.
name: Ace

Return to the Amalgam Age of Comics: The Marvel Comics Collection

deck: Amalgam version of June Robbins and Alicia Masters
description:
June Masters is the Amalgam version of DC's June Robbins and Marvel's Alicia Masters.
 
June is the daughter of the villain known as Multi-Masters, who once used his creation Ultivac the Multi-Robot to destroy the Challengers of the Fantastic. 
 
June helps the Challengers of the Fantastic with her scientific skills. She is also blind. June is responsible for talking the Silver Racer into interfering with Galactiac's attack on Earth.
name: June Masters

deck: Amalgam version of Big Bear and Gorgon
description:
Origin

Big Gorgon is an Asgod who lives in New Asgard. He is a member of the Un-People, a group of other New Gods. He is an amalgamation of Big Bear and Gorgon. 

Creation

Big Gorgon was created by Karl Kesel, Tom Grummett and Al Vey. Big Bear was created by Jack Kirby. Gorgon was created by Stan Lee and Jack Kirby. 

Major Story Arcs

Strange Tales of the Unexpected 

One of the other Un-People, Dream Crystal, is ordered to stay away from her lover, Johnny "Red" Storm. Big Gorgon joins the other Un-People in separating the young lovers and dragging Dream Crystal back to New Asgard.
name: Big Gorgon

volume_credits.name: Return to the Amalgam Age of Comics: The Marvel Comics Collection

deck: Amalgam version of Beautiful Dreamer and Crystal
description:
Origin

Dream Crystal is an Asgod who lives in New Asgard. She is a member of the Un-People, a team of Asgods. She is an amalgamation of Beautiful Dreamer and Crystal 

Creation

Dream Crystal was created by Karl Kesel, Tom Grummett and Al Vey. Beautiful Dreamer was created by Jack Kirby. Crystal was created by Stan Lee and Jack Kirby.  

Major Story Arcs

Strange Tales of the Unexpected 

Dream Crystal is romantically involved with Johnny "Red" Storm, however, her team leader, Vykin the Black Bolt, forbids the pair to remain together. He and the other Un-People forcibly separate the pair. Later, Dream Crystal disobeys Vykin and goes to visit Red at Challenger Mountain, though they are interrupted by a visit from Red's ex-girlfriend, Corinna Evans.
name: Dream Crystal

Creation

Medusa Moonrider was created by Karl Kesel, Tom Grummett and Al Vey. Mark Moonrider was created by Jack Kirby. Medusa was created by Stan Lee and Jack Kirby.  

Major Story Arcs

Strange Tales of the Unexpected

One of the other Un-People, Dream Crystal, is ordered to stay away from Johnny "Red" Storm, her lover. Medusa Moonrider joins her teammates in separating the young lovers and dragging Dream Crystal back to New Asgard.

Vykin the Black Bolt was created by Karl Kesel, Tom Grummett and Al Vey. Vykin the Black was created by Jack Kirby. Black Bolt was created by Stan Lee and Jack Kirby.

Ultivac the Multi-Robot was created by Multi-Masters to defeat the Challengers of the Fantastic.
name: Ultivac

volume_credits.name: Return to the Amalgam Age of Comics: The Marvel Comics Collection

deck: Sometimes getting to live with the girl you're in love with is not the best thing that can happen to you.
description:
Masashi Rando is the toughest boy, and best martial artist in Seika High, as well as a bully and more than a bit of a jerk, he and his cronies, who acknowledge him as their leader, generally being called thugs behind their backs.

Rando is afraid of nothing, and yet he can’t bring himself to talk to Rina Kurimi the sweet and intelligent girl he has a crush on and whom he keeps a number secretly taken pictures with him at all times.

Life changes for Masashi when while on his way home the bus he is riding on is struck by an out of control truck, sending it over a cliff where it busts into flames.

The next thing Rando knows he awakes in a strange place, the laboratory of Dr. Manabe, Masashi Rando’s first shock is to find that he has been in a coma for a full year.

His next is the revelation is that the somewhat mad Dr. Manabe, who just happens to be a master plastic surgeon, was the person who pulled him, the only survivor of the crash, to safety and over the year Rando was in a coma has rebuilt his badly crushed and burned face, unfortunately for Rando, Dr. Manabe was also taken by the pictures of  Rina Kurimi he found on Rando and so reconstructed his face based them, so that Rando awakes to find himself, while still a boy otherwise, Rina’s identical twin, the resemblances is heightened due to the weight and muscle lose that took place during his year in a coma.

Rando’s first thought is to get back to his family, obtaining clothing from Dr. Manabe, who in a example of his eccentric nature (perverted in Rando’s opinion) is a set of girls clothing in his size.

running to his old home he finds that his family has moved away to parts unknown due to not being able to deal with the supposed death of their son.

Trying to deal with this Rondo wanders off in a funk and runs into Rina Kurimi who mistakes Rondo for her long missing older sister Yuna who disappeared years before.

When Rondo is unable to come up with a believable explanation about who he is Rina jumps to the conclusion that this means that Rando must be her sister Yuna and that she is suffering from amnesia.

In quick order Rondo is taken to Rina’s home where he is taken into the family as the missing Yuna and soon finds himself back at his old school where he has to deal with being thought the sister of the girl he’s in love with, fending off his old cronies hitting on someone they think is a girl, and other complications from amorous teachers, to trying to get his old martial arts skills back.

Rondo is aided in all this by Dr. Manabe who helps him from time to time with things like making it so Rondo can keep his new identity from being found out by the school’s yearly mandatory physical exam to blending in with the girls at school, and perhaps even eventually getting his old face back.

As can be expected nothing runs smoothly for Masashi Rando.
name: Masashi Rando

deck: Corbin
description:
Legal Status: US Citizen
Place of Birth: Brugge, Belgium
Blood Type: B
Rank: Lt. Col.
Occupation: Military, Special Operations
Language: English, Arabic, Kurdish, Armenian, French, Dutch
Base of Operations: Fort Huachuca, AZ
Known Affiliations: US Army, US Marine Corps, Military Intelligence Corps
 
 
History:

After completing Military Intelligence Officer Basic at Fort Huachuca, he attended the Defense Language Institute, displaying a proclivity for languages. He was enrolled in Arabic and picked up Kurdish and Armenian on his own. Instrumental in bringing Pervez Musharraf of Pakistan to power in 1999 and the Sonthi Boonyaratgin in Thailand in 2006, both of which were a bloodless coup that proved to be beneficial to certain U.S. interests.

Decorations:

Distinguished Service Cross, two Silver Stars, Bronze Star with Valor Device, Legion of Merit, Meritorious Service Medal, Joint Service Commendation Medal, Combat Infantry Badge, Ranger Tab, Scuba Badge and numerous foreign awards.
name: Corbin

deck: Vladimir Dychenko
description:
Legal Status: Russian

Place of Birth:

Kauchuk, Kazakhstan

Blood Type:

AB

Rank:

M.D., Ph.D., Sc.D.

Occupation:

Director of Bioprat

Language:

Biological warfare expert

Work History:

Tomsk Medical Institute

Institute of Applied Biochemistry, Omutninsk Kazakhstan Scientific and Production Base in Stepnogorsk. Stepnogorsk was established as a secret town with code names Tselinograd, Makinsk. The town is known as a nuclear and biochemical site.

Language: Russian, English, Kazakh

Base of Operations:

Obolensk, Russia

State Research Center for Applied Microbiology

Known Affiliations:

KGB, FSB

History:

Deputy director of Bioprat in the early 90’s. He had years of biohazard field experience. Dychenko maintains direct oversight of world’s largest collections of anthrax, working with about 30 live strains and perhaps 10 times as many variants. He secured the most deadly bio-weapon known to man, M4211, from an excavation site in the Henan Valley, China.

Dychenko and his colleagues tested a number of deadly poisons on prisoners. The goal of the experiments was to find a tasteless, odorless chemical that could not be detected post mortem. A radioactive substance known as polonium 210 was reportedly developed in a poison laboratory of the Soviet secret services, also known as Laboratory 1, Laboratory 12 and “The Chamber.” It is believed that a Russian dissident, Colonel Alexander Litvinenko, was poisoned in London with polonium 210 at Millennium Hotel in London.
name: Vladimir Dychenko

deck: Ivan
description:
Ivan

Legal Status: Russian
Place of Birth: Moscow
Education: University of Moscow
Blood Type: O
Rank: Colonel, Russian Federation
Decorations:
Distinguished Service in Guarding The State Border,
Distinguished Military Service (1st Class)
Language: Russian, English, Ancient Scythian
Base of Operations: Rostov
Known Affiliations: Communist Party

History:

Ivan led the Russian invasion force earned a degree in ancient history  from the University of Moscow.  He modeled many of the battle techniques after the ancient Scythians. They were a fierce barbaric horsemen sacrificed every hundredth man taken into war to their gods. War was their main business – they neither plowed nor sowed – being nomads they traveled extensively, inhabiting a region rather than establishing definite boundaries. They broke through the barrier of the Caucasus in 632 BC and swept down like a swarm of locusts upon Assyria.

For Ivan this was his chance to relive history. He often called his troops Scythians to motivate them for battle. As Ivan gave the order to attack he imagined himself leading the ancient tribe of warriors. Ivan was quick to point out the Iranian connection with his Iranian allies. The language of the Scythians was a form of Iranian, one of the branches of the Indo-European languages.  As he contemplated the battle – he envisioned the Russian paratroopers ascending from the sky, like the coming of a storm that could not be predicted or stopped. Covering the land of Israel – destroying this plague on the land once and for all! Little did he know that the God of Heaven had anticipated they move before he annals of time.  All of their efforts would be brought to naught. No one would be able to stand against the divine plan of God.

Ivan would face Corbin in battle — these two warriors fought for something more than their countries – they fought for honor
name: Ivan

deck: Jada
description:
• Legal Status: US Citizen
  • Place of Birth: Freemont, NB
  • Blood Type: hh (Bombay Blood)
  • Occupation: Software Engineer
  • Language: English, French, Arabic
  • Marital Status: Single
  • Affiliations: Mensa International; Triple Nine Society
  • ase of Operations: San Francisco, CA

Origin

Jada Smith holds an M.S. from USC with a concentration in software engineering. She developed data mining software that utilized complex algorithms for industrial and military application.

Jada is high security risk and is under constant surveillance. She became involved with a Russian FSB agent from Prague.

Jada has a very rare blood type known as subtype hh or Bombay Blood type. It is the rarest type being completely outside the ABO system. Four units of hh blood are stored in cryopreservation at the Institute of Immuno-haematology.
name: Jada Smith

deck: The older sister of Pegasus Seiya.  She follows Seiya to Greece looking for him.
description:
Seika and her younger brother Seiya lived in an orphanage for a few years, until Mitsumasa Kido separated them.  He took Seiya away to train to become a Saint, saying that Seiya could not see his sister again until he brought back a Bronze Cloth.  Unbeknownst to Seiya, Seika followed her brother all the way to Greece.  She fell while trying to climb up a cliff, and the resulting head injury caused amnesia.  An old man took her in, and she lived for years in the village next to Sanctuary, remembering nothing of her brother. 
 
Aquila Marin finally discovered her while Seiya was fighting in the Underworld.  During their battle, Thanatos read Seiya's heart and saw his desire to see his sister.  As revenge for managing to wound him, Thanatos decided to kill Seika in front of Seiya before finishing the fight.  He attempted to attack her psychically, but Marin, Shaina, Jabu, Ichi, Nachi, Ban, and Geki shielded her from Thanatos' attacks.  Seika could feel Seiya's Cosmo, and her memory returned.  Seiya's desire to reunite with his sister is what gave him the strength to keep fighting until Hades was defeated.

issue_credits.name: To A World Brimming Over With Light...!

name: Seika

volume_credits.name: Saint Seiya: Knights of the Zodiac

deck: Member of the Sun Lubbers pirate crew who had map of New York's secret subway system tattooed on his back.
description:
Origin

Very little is known about Soapy. At some point, possibly in Captain Falsebeard's day, he descended into New York's subway system and joined the subway pirates operating there. Sometime after that the secret map of the subways was tattooed on his back.

Creation

Soapy was created by Grant Morrison and Cameron Stewart. He made his first appearance in Seven Soldiers: Guardian #1.

Major Story Arcs

Seven Soldiers of Victory

Soapy is attacked by a rival pirate crew, the Dead Dogs. His back is flayed by No-Beard, who steals his tattoo map and leaves him behind. He is later captured by his former crew, the Sun Lubbers. He is set on fire by All-Beard and dragged, burning, behind the train, to his death.

Powers and Abilities

Soapy has no known superhuman powers or abilities.
name: Soapy

deck: Captain of the subway pirate crew the Dead Dogs, and arch-enemy of All-Beard.
description:
Origin

An escaped mental patient, Eamon Garcia descended below the streets of New York and joined the under-pirates, taking the name No-Beard and eventually becoming captain of his own crew, the Dead Dogs, on his own train, the President Clinton.

Creation

No-Beard was created by Grant Morrison and Cameron Stewart. He made his first appearance in Seven Soldiers: Guardian #1.

Major Story Arcs

Seven Soldiers of Victory

No-Beard discovers that Soapy has the map to the fabled Foundation Stone, which is rumoured to grant whoever holds it rulership over the under-pirates. He leads his crew in pursuit of the Foundation Stone, hoping to acquire it ahead of his mortal enemy, All-Beard. On the way, he encounters the Guardian, and joins forces with him to launch an attack on All-Beard's Sun Lubbers. When the trains crash he survives, and discovers that the Foundation Stone is a simple die. He stumbles through an irradiated lake and promises to battle All-Beard for its possession. The events are unknown, but he fails to acquire the Foundation Stone. Poisoned and slowly dying, he pilots his doomed train through the New York subways as he waits to die.

Powers and Abilities

No-Beard has no known superhuman powers or abilities. He is missing both his hands, and has replaced them with sharp hooks. He is a competent, if somewhat unhinged, leader.
name: No-Beard

aliases:
All-Beard the Intoxicated
Master of the Night-Frigate
Worm Almighty
deck: Subway pirate and leader of the Sun Lubbers
description:
Origin

Very little is known about All-Beard. At some point he descended into the subway system, where he became the captain of a pirate train.

Creation

All-Beard was created by Grant Morrison and Cameron Stewart. He made his first appearance in Seven Soldiers: Guardian #1

Major Story Arcs

Seven Soldiers of Victory

All-Beard leads his pirates on a raid of an N line subway platform to kill Soapy and capture slaves, among them Carla Marcus, the girlfriend of the Manhattan Guardian. He leads his crew in a race against No-Beard to find the fabled god machine located deep below New York. After both trains crash during the fighting, All-Beard manages to stumble through a lake of radioactive waste and recover the god machine. There, he fights with No-Beard. He is presumed dead, either by No-Beard's hand, or as a result of radiation poisoning.

Powers and Abilities

All-Beard has no known superhuman powers or abilities. He is a ruthless pirate captain, but appears to be at least half mad. Despite this, he seems to have some prophetic awareness to his ramblings, as he described things he could not know about, such as Aurakles. He has some armed and unarmed fighting ability.
name: All-Beard

deck: Mother of Carla Marcus
description:
Origin

Very little is known about Lauren Marcus. Probably originally from New York City, she met Larry Marcus at some point in her life, and later married him. They had one daughter together, Carla Marcus.

Creation

Lauren Marcus was created by Grant Morrison and Cameron Stewart. She made her first appearance in Seven Soldiers: Guardian #1.

Major Story Arcs

Seven Soldiers of Victory

Lauren worries over the faltering relationship of her daughter and Jake Jordan, and supports Jake's decision to take the job as the Manhattan Guardian. Her husband dies in a subway pirate attack shortly thereafter, which devastates her. Despite this, she objects to her daughter's decision to leave Jake, and continues to try to coax her to take him back even during the Sheeda invasion. She and Carla attempt to escape the city, but nearly crash into Zatanna. They are rescued by Jake, and Lauren survives the invasion.

Powers and Abilities

Lauren has no known superhuman powers or abilities.
name: Lauren Marcus

deck: Father of Carla Marcus.
description:
Origin

Very little is known about Larry Marcus. As a child, he was friends with the members of the Newsboy Army, and occasionally helped them during their missions. After the Army collapsed, he grew up and married, and had at least one child, Carla.

Creation

Larry Marcus was created by Grant Morrison and Cameron Stewart. He made his first appearance in Seven Soldiers: Guardian #1.

Major Story Arcs

Seven Soldiers of Victory

Concerned about his daughter's partner, Jake Jordan, Larry speaks with his childhood friend, Ed Stargard. He explains that he believes Jordan can become a hero, if he is given an origin. Ed agrees to take Jordan on as the Manhattan Guardian, and Larry draws Jordan's attention to the want ad and convinces him to take the job. He and his daughter Carla are on the N line when it is besieged by All-Beard's pirates. He dies from wounds sustained in the pirate attacks, but lives long enough to beg Jake to go after the pirates.

Powers and Abilities

Larry has no known superhuman powers or abilities.
name: Larry Marcus

deck: The fiancée of Jake Jordan
description:
Origin

The daughter of Larry and Lauren Marcus, Carla was raised in New York. At some point she met and began dating Jake Jordan, with whom she had a good relationship, until he was involved in an accidental shooting. She remained with him, but grew increasingly impatient with his inability to move on.

Creation

Carla Marcus was created by Grant Morrison and Cameron Stewart. She made her first appearance in Seven Soldiers: Guardian #1.

Major Story Arcs

Seven Soldiers of Victory

Carla argues with Jake about money, as he is currently unemployed, which partially spurs him to take the position of the Manhattan Guardian. Shortly thereafter, she and her father take the subway to meet Jake, but are waylaid by All-Beard's pirates. She is captured, while her father is killed. Jake is able to rescue her and several other pirate captives. She withdraws from Jake for a time following her father's death, and breaks off their relationship on the night he attempts to propose. Later, she and her mother become caught up in the simultaneous Sheeda invasion and hurricane. Attempting to flee through the chaos, she nearly crashes into Zatanna. She is rescued by Jake, whom she realizes she still loves. The pair reconcile, and together survive the invasion.

Powers and Abilities

Carla has no known superhuman powers or abilities.
name: Carla Marcus

deck: A 13-year old boy who was accidentally shot and killed by Jake Jordan
description:
Origin

Very little is known about Tyree Plantain. He was probably born and raised in New York City.

Creation

Tyree was created by Grant Morrison and Cameron Stewart. He made his first appearance in Seven Soldiers: Guardian #1.

Major Story Arcs

Seven Soldiers of Victory

While shopping for onions for his grandmother, Tyree is accidentally shot by Jake Jordan, who mistakes him for a drug dealer who had shot Jordan's partner.

Powers and Abilities

Tyree has no known superhuman powers or abilities.
name: Tyree Plantain

deck: A founding member of original Newsboy Army, and later founder and editor of "The Manhattan Guardian" newspaper.
description:
Origin

Born with a genius-level intellect, as an infant Edward Stargard joined other unusual and extraordinary children to form the Newsboy Army. Due to the corruption of his character arc by the Terrible Time Tailor Zor, his body matured but failed to develop in the usual way, leaving him a massive, disfigured infant. Following the collapse of the Newsboy Army, Stargard grew reclusive. He eventually opened The Manhattan Guardian, a daily newspaper which resurrected the concept of the Newsboy Army to write and research its articles.

Creation

Ed Stargard was created by Grant Morrison and Cameron Stewart. He made his first appearance in Seven Soldiers: Guardian #1.

Major Story Arcs

Seven Soldiers of Victory

Ed recruits Jake Jordan to take the position of the Guardian, the mascot for his newspaper. He sends Jordan to investigate the reports of subway piracy. Despite Jordan's concerns over the safety of the job and his family, Ed is able to convince him to remain with the paper. He later sends Jordan to investigate the troubles in Century Hollow, and backs him up with several members of the Newsboy Army. When Jordan again attempts to quit, Ed reveals his true nature to him. He reveals the dark history of the Newsboy Army, the Terrible Time Tailor, and the imminent return of the Sheeda. He reveals that Jordan is one of the Seven Soldiers, destined to destroy the Sheeda menace once and for all. Jordan brings Ed into the fray, from which he reports on the ongoing events. It is presumed he survives the Sheeda invasion.

Powers and Abilities

Ed possesses a genius-level intellect, and from infancy was capable of full, cogent, and informed speech and thought. He is widely read and knowledgeable in a number of areas, including business administration. While in the Guardian headquarters, he interfaces with various computer systems, allowing him to control much of the building and his business operations.

issue_credits.name: Sex Secrets of the Newsboy Army!

name: Ed Stargard

deck: Earth golem and the last of Golems Four
description:
Origin

Created by Ed Stargard when he was a teenager, presumably in the traditional manner, Brutus was one of four elemental golems designed to aid in Stargard's fight against crime. At some point all other members of the Golems Four were destroyed, leaving only Brutus to guard their creator.

Creation

Brutus was created by Grant Morrison and Cameron Stewart. He made his first appearance in Seven Soldiers: Guardian #1.

Major Story Arcs

Seven Soldiers of Victory

Brutus is among the tasks that are set by Stargard to test the mettle of Jake Jordan. He is defeated when Jordan wipes the writing on his head off. He continues to stand guard over Stargard after this incident. During the Sheeda invasion he joins Stargard in combatting the Sheeda. It is presumed he survives.

Powers and Abilities

Brutus is a golem made of clay. He is invulnerable and superhumanly strong. He is a capable unarmed fighter, primarily reliant on his strength as he lacks great mental capacity.

Weapons and Equipment

Brutus carries two large, heavy hammers which he wields as weapons.
name: Brutus

deck: Member of the Newsboy Army
description:
Origin

Very little is known about Edward Lincoln. At some point he joined the Newsboy Army as a roving reporter and investigator for the Manhattan Guardian newspaper.

Creation

Edward was created by Grant Morrison and Cameron Stewart. He made his first appearance in Seven Soldiers: Guardian #1.

Major Story Arcs

Seven Soldiers of Victory

Edward is nearest to the new Guardian's location when he requires transportation, and relinquishes his pizza delivery motorcycle to the Guardian. Later, he is amongst the members of the Army who are parachuted into Century Hollow to assist the Guardian's battle agains the rogue robots.

Powers and Abilities

Edward has no known superhuman powers or abilities. He has received training as an investigator and reporter, as well as having some experience with base jumping and close combat.
name: Edward J. Lincoln

deck: A member of the Sun Lubbers who uses chains in battle
description:
Origin

Very little is known about Fights-With-Chains. At some point he descended into the subway system, where he became a member of the Sun Lubbers, one of the subway pirate crews that haunt the tunnels below New York.

Creation

Fights-With-Chains was created by Grant Morrison and Cameron Stewart. He made his first appearance in Seven Soldiers: Guardian #2

Major Story Arcs

Seven Soldiers of Victory

Fights-With-Chains joins his crew in carrying out a raid on a subway platform, and is among those clamouring to kill the Guardian as he trails behind their train. He later fights and is defeated by the Guardian when the hero launches an attack in concert with the Dead Dogs. He is on the train when it crashes, and is later seen lying in the wreckage. His fate is unknown, presumed dead.

Powers and Abilities

Fights-With-Chains has no known superhuman powers or abilities. He is physically very strong, and wields heavy chains as a weapon.

Weapons and Equipment

Fights-With-Chains carries several heavy chains, which he wields as weapons.
name: Fights-With-Chains

deck: Member of the Dead Dogs pirate crew
description:
Origin

Very little is known about Jenny Greenteeth. At some point she descended into the subway system, where she became a member of the Dead Dogs, one of the subway pirate crews that haunt the tunnels below New York.

Creation

Jenny Greenteeth was created by Grant Morrison and Cameron Stewart. She made her first appearance in Seven Soldiers: Guardian #2

Major Story Arcs

Seven Soldiers of Victory

Jenny Greenteeth encourages No-Beard to allow Guardian to join them in launching an attack on their mortal enemies, the Sun Lubbers. She is on the trains when they crash. Her fate is unknown, presumed dead.

Powers and Abilities

Jenny Greenteeth has no known superhuman powers or abilities.
name: Jenny Greenteeth

deck: Owner of an arthouse cinema in the Washington Galleria and brief captive of subway pirates
description:
Origin

Very little is known about Bill Brazil. At some point he opened a successful arthouse cinema in the Washington Galleria.

Creation

Bill Brazil was created by Grant Morrison and Cameron Stewart. He made his first appearance in Seven Soldiers: Guardian #2.

Major Story Arcs

Seven Soldiers of Victory

Bill Brazil is among several subway riders who are kidnapped by All-Beard's Sun Lubbers during a pirate raid on a subway platform. He is one of two hostages rescued by the Guardian. He is injured during the rescue, and slowly goes into shock while they are escaping the tunnels and returning to the surface.

Powers and Abilities

Bill has no known superhuman powers or abilities.
name: Bill Brazil

deck: Pet cat of Cassandra Craft
description:
Origin

Very little is known about Prowley's origins. He appears to be magical in nature, and meows in hieroglyphics. At some point he became the pet cat of Cassandra Craft.

Creation

Prowley was created by Grant Morrison and Ryan Sook. He made his first appearance in Seven Soldiers: Zatanna #2.

Major Story Arcs

Seven Soldiers of Victory

Living in Cassandra's shop, Prowley meets and takes a liking to Misty Kilgore. He is mimicked by the Gwydion when it begins attacking Zatanna. He is taken out of the shop by Cassandra, and remains there until Gwydion is defeated.

Powers and Abilities

Prowley is a cat. His owner is able to see magical auras through his eyes. It is hinted that he is able to enter the dreams of others and interact with those who are dreaming.
name: Prowley

deck: Minor demon who can persuade people to do forbidden things
description:
Origin

Very little is known about the Tempter. He is a minor demon who was sent to Earth at some point to tempt humanity into sinning.

Creation

The Tempter was created by Mike Friedrich and Dick Dillin. He made his first appearance in World's Finest Comics #209.

Major Story Arcs

Meet the Tempter-- and Die!

The Tempter worms his way into the minds of several heroes, using his powers to persuade them to grow more brutal, jealous, and conniving. He manipulates Hawkgirl, Hawkman, Kro-Al, Lois Lane, and Superman in an effort to destroy Superman. He manages to create a web of manipulation that nearly convinces Superman to destroy Midway City. He is defeated when his temptations run too counter to the natures of his victims; Hawkgirl and Hawkman shake off his manipulations, followed soon after by Lois and Superman.

Seven Soldiers of Victory

Living in increasingly reduced circumstances due to the availability and ubiquity of temptations in the modern world, the Tempter is encountered by Zatanna and Misty Kilgore, having just talked a group of dieters into eating themselves to death. He is easily exorcised by Misty, and becomes one of the beings riding on the bus of the dead. On the bus he tries to tempt the newly-dead Vincenzo Baldi, but is prevented by Ali-Ka-Zoom.

Powers and Abilities

The Tempter is a minor demon, able to uncover and manipulate the emotions of others. Acting as a sort of anti-conscience, he can whisper suggestions to people which they do not consciously register as outside influence, and which they will then conform to. He is able to make himself invisible while carrying out his manipulations. He may be able to teleport himself, or else to appear in multiple minds at once. As a demon, he has an extended lifespan

first_appeared_in_issue.name: Meet the Tempter.... and Die! ; Tweedledum and Tweedledee

issue_credits.name: Meet the Tempter.... and Die! ; Tweedledum and Tweedledee

name: Tempter

aliases:
Dark Doctor
Surgeon of Death
Trafalgar D. Water Law
deck: Trafalgar Law is the captain of the Heart Pirates and one of the Eleven Supernovas. He ate the OP-Op Devil Fruit and can modify anything within his created area of effect. He is a rival and temporary ally for Luffy with a bounty of 500,000,000 Berries.
description:
Appearance

Trafalgar Law is a thin man with tanned skin. He often wears a yellow and black sweatshirt with his crew's Jolly Rodger on his chest. His sleeves are always rolled up, revealing tribal tattoos on his arms. He also has the letters D,E,T, and H tattooed on his right fingers, spelling Death without the A. Law says he is from the North Sea, specifically the North Blue. He wears the traditional Northern hat, but his has an animal print on it, along with his jeans. He has light shadows under both of is eyes, and he is always smiling a small smile. The only time he frowns is when people tell him what to do.

History

Trafalgar Law was born in North Blue to wealthy parents in the 'White City' of Flevance. He had a younger sister called Lami and the young man studied hard to follow in his Father's footsteps to become a doctor. Flevance was a prosperous nation mainly due to it being home to Amber Lead, an expensive mineral that was mined there. However, unbeknownst to the people of Flevance, Amber Lead was a poisonous substance, symptoms include white blotches appearing on the skin and drowsiness leading to eventual death. The World Government knew of Amber Lead poisoning but did not notify the citizens of the White City because they saw how much money was being made trading it.

Unfortunately, soon Flevance saw a large majority of their population falling victim to Amber Lead poisoning, including Law's sister who rapidly entered an advanced stage of the disease. What made things worse was the fact that no doctor could cure or treat the disease, even Law's father-the best doctor in the country, couldn't do anything to stop Amber Lead poisoning.

Neighbouring countries feared that the disease was contagious (It wasn't) and started to panic so the World Government deployed Marines to Flevance to massacre the diseased.

Law's sister was in hospital and refused a Nun's offer to sneak him along with other children, including his class mates, off the island. Law couldn't bring himself to leave his sister. The Marines killed the Nun and Law's classmates, shot Law's parents and burned down the hospital where Law's sister was. Law then suffered a mental break down, crying uncontrollably. But he still managed to evade capture by hiding under a pile of dead bodies the Marines were stacking outside of the country's walls.

Law entire nature changed dramatically from this tragedy: he became cruel and nihilistic, wanting only to kill as many people as he could before dying from Amber Lead poisoning.

Not too long after this event, Law arrived at Spider Miles, which was a port town the Donquixote pirates were temporarily staying in. He approached Donquixote Doflamingo with bombs strapped to his body and asked him to let him join his crew. He informed the pirate Captain that he only had three years left to live and wanted to inflict as much pain and suffering on others as he could. Doflamingo was curious to know if there were any survivors to which Law told him he didn't know. Doflamingo's younger brother, Corazon then entered the room and unceremoniously threw Law out the window where the young boy landed on junk metal. Law survived this and angrily demanded to know why it had happened. He was then told by the family that Corazon hated kids. But was warned that their was a stead fast rule in place which meant you couldn't harm a member of the family. Law swore his revenge on Corazon anyway and a few days later he stabbed him with a sword. Unfortunately he was seen by Buffalo, but Law managed to bribe him to not tell Doflamingo by buying him ice cream.

Law was paranoid that Buffalo would still tell Doflamingo so he attempted to flee but was caught by Jora and Machvise. They took him to Doflamingo in their dining room where Law noticed that Corazon didn't die from his stab wound. Doflamingo decided to welcome Law into the family and the Captain was informed by Corazon that his injury was by the hands of an enemy. Law reinforced the fact that he only had three years to live, to which Doflamingo replied by saying his Underworld business would lead him to the Ope Ope ni Mi Devil Fruit, the 'Ultimate Devil Fruit' said to be able to cure any disease. He told Law that if he found a way to survive longer than three years, he'd be awarded the position of the Heart seat in the family and become his right hand man in a decade.

For the next few years, Law accompanied the Donquixote pirates on various acts of piracy on multiple islands. During this time he was taught swordsmanship by Diamante, gunnery by Gladius and martial arts by Lao G.

Personality

Law is a very carefree man, and can be almost always seen smiling. However, he gave another pirate the finger when he called Trafalgar rude, and casually asked another how many Marines he had killed. He also enjoys watching other people fight, as he thinks that other will battle over simple things. But, he is kind to other people, as shown when he offers Jean Bart a place on his crew because of him being an escaped slave. He is also respectful of Eustass Kidd, calling him "Mister Kidd" and helping him to take on a Pacifista. He is also reckless which makes him a more wanted target by the world government when in a fight. He is also blunt when comes to answering questions. When Jimbei asked what would happen to Luffy if he moved around to much when he gets to the island Law simply stated his wounds would open and he would die. He and Bepo are usually seen together and he sometimes has Bepo holding his long Japanese sword called a Nodachi.

Law has displayed a more competitive side about him in the anime where he, along with Kid and Luffy, got into a childish argument about who gets to take down the marines stationed just outside the Human Auctioning House when the three Supernovas came out to confront them. In contrast, he does not seem as eager to reach the New World as the other Supernova crews are, believing that One Piece will still be there regardless while the other crews fight among themselves, and that he needs to steal the throne "properly".

Sabaody Archipelago Arc

Like the other Supernovas, he was first shown having arrived at the Archipelago with his crew before heading for the New World. He was the final Supernova to be introduced, seen sitting on a crate as X Drake, another Supernova, passed by after having broken up a fight between Urouge and Killer , before he asked how many people Drake had slain (in the anime, he was apparently on the scene moments before Drake appeared, clearly enjoying the fight between Urouge and Killer). Later, Eustass Kid observed him in the Auction House on Grove 1, where he revealed that what he had heard about Law was not very pleasant. Law replied with flipping him off, causing Kid to note that Law was lacking manners. As the auctioning continued, Law only observed in boredom.

After Luffy attacked one of the Nobles , he was seen smiling at the reckless action that his fellow Supernova had performed. A short while after, Law revealed to Luffy that the auction house was surrounded by Marines, since the Archipelago was so close to Marine Headquarters. Later, after Silvers had knocked out the majority of the soldiers standing in the pirates way, he was seen still standing, along with his crew, the Straw-Hats, Kid, Killer, and their crew as well. After the Straw-Hats and Rayleigh prepared to leave the Auction House before the admiral would show up, Kid told Luffy and Law to stay back as he would hold off the Marine grunts, much to both Law and Luffy's annoyance. Then, the trio demonstrated their powers to hold off the Marines, Law utilizing a field where he replaced a grunt's head with a cannon ball fired at him.

As the fight continued, Law was busy with switching around the Marine soldiers body parts in order to confuse them and beat them. Later, when the trio had defeated the first wave, Law noted that Luffy had shrunk due to the side-effects of Gear 3rd. After everyone had exited the Auction House, the Marines began a heavier assault on the pirates. At that moment, when Luffy proclaimed that he will be the one to find One Piece , Kid told Law and Luffy that the three would meet each other in the New World , to which Law only smiled. Then, as a bigger Marine grunt tried to attack him, he ordered his bear companion Bepo, to attack them, but he was done fighting. Before he exited the scene, he recruited Jean Bart a former slave into his crew, to which the captain accepted wholeheartedly, although Law told him that half of the thanks would have to go to Luffy. Afterward he and his crew make an escape but came across the Kid Pirates fighting a cyborg clone of Kuma . The cyborg Kuma attacks him with an energy blast but he manages to avoid it before he and Kid prepare to fight him.

Marineford Arc

During the war, Law and his crew were initially present on the Sabaody Archipelago where the broadcast of Ace's execution was being shown. He was presumably watching the events at aces execution unfold, along with his fellow Supernovas, as he ordered Bepo and Jean Bart to set sail immediately after the broadcast was cut.Towards the end of the battle, as Jinbei and Buggy fled the conflict with a critically injured Luffy, Law emerged from the ocean in his ship, a submarine. With Bepo and Jean Bart at his back, Law told Buggy that he is a doctor, and ordered him to hand over Luffy for medical treatment. He claimed that although Straw Hat may become an enemy of his in the future, Law would not allow that destiny to go unfulfilled by letting him die now.

As the war gets more intense, Law continues to tell Buggy to drop Luffy and Jinbei to his ship. Just as Buggy is about to, he is shot through his shoulder by Kizaru and throws them at Law's ship as he flees. As Jean Bart catches them he orders his crew to dive, but as soon as they're leaving, Kizaru shows up and tries to capture them. Luckily the distraction of Coby and the Red-Haired pirates allowed them to leave the battle ground. But before his vessel could fully submerge, Buggy, who was convinced by Shanks to help return his hat back to Luffy , threw Luffy's signature hat at the submarines opening hatch right before Law sealed it off, and was promptly caught by Law. He then commenced to supervising Luffy and Jinbei's medical treatment while putting the Straw Hat on the side table, as the submarine is evading Aokiji's ice attacks and Kizaru's lasers.

Powers and Abilities

Law is a fearsome pirate who, along with most of his crew, proved resistant to Rayleigh's burst of Haki that took out almost everyone in the Auction house. He has earned the nickname "Surgeon of Death" due to his medical prowess in addition to his formidable combat abilities.

'Law is a skilled swordsman, and has knowledge in medical fields due to his study at medical school. He's eaten the Op-Op Devil Fruit transforming him into a free modify human. Allowing him to create a spherical territory, in which he can disassemble, reform, and telekinetically control matter.

He can also cause other people to switch places in his field, as shown when he puts a Marine in the path of a cannonball shot at Bepo. Law can even teleport himself around the space he has opened up at will, even being able to swap out with something else exchanging places. Anything within his area space of influence is his to control to a tee, Law often uses his sword as a makeshift scalpel to cleave people or the surroundings apart even from afar, while people being affected by this power are normally left unharmed and can easily be brought back together if their split parts have been properly realigned, however his 'Radio knife' technique severs appendages and leaves them unable to be reattached for several minutes. Furthermore, what is perhaps Law's most powerful attack is his 'Gamma Knife.' A gamma Knife is a form of radio surgery to treat brain tumors, however Law uses it in an offensive manner: he gathers energy and shapes it into a short blade which he then plunges into his enemies internal organs for to inflict fatal damage (Doflamingo would have died if not for his ability to stitch his organs back together)- The damages to the terrain within it are permanently altered and remain so long after the power has been diffused. The circles which form in his hands acts as an indicator to when he is activating his ROOM space as shown when he and Kid were fighting the Pacifista, or when Law fought against Smoker and his marines at Punk Hazard. While his territory is active law can accomplish other feats as well, including scanning the area similar to an X-ray, swap people's minds and bodies completely and indefinitely until canceled out - but still needing the proper proximity to and between hosts to reverse his doings, even boasting attacks and abilities operating without the necessity of his ROOM. Such as the removal of hearts from individual bodies converting them into cubic containers making them vulnerable to harm; a critical skill as any unprotected vital organ (E.I. the human heart) can cause extreme pain when tampered with or instant death if severely damaged. The second is a static shock like burst of energy applied when both hands are pressed together against an adversary knocking them out near instantly. He as the usual Devil Fruit users weakness of being unable to swim. Besides the standard faults, his DF power requires a lot of concentration and focus on his part to "operate" a draw back to his power is the fact that constant use of the Room Field drains his stamina with each conjuring, this makes both him and the effectiveness of the space's influence weaker with every usage. Law has little patience for people he sees as small minded; when Luffy cared more about the fact that Law had a talking bear as a crew mate then the thousands of Marines outside, he became angry, however he, like most people Luffy is affiliated with is drawn to Luffy and respects him after the Dressrosa arc.

Swordsmanship

Law has demonstrated a high level of proficiency in sword play, having been trained since the age of 10 by the Donquixote's family executive and master swordsman, Diamante.

He has been skilled enough to match the formidable Marine Vice Admiral Smoker in a sword to jitte fight, a battle which Law eventually won.

Furthermore he has been adept enough to briefly hold his own against Doflamingo on top of the Warlord's plaza. Doflamingo attacked Law several times with his strings with unrelenting speed and precision, yet Law was skilled enough to parry and block his attacks. At one point Law even managed to land 'Injection Shot' on the Warlord, drawing blood from his stomach. Law's sword, Kikoku is his preferred weapon of choice, it is a cursed sword in One Piece and is a larger version of the Japanese sword type, nodachi.

Marksmanship

Law has been shown to have training in marksmanship from the Donquixote's top fire arms specialist, Gladius, since he was 10 years old:

However he has not been seen wielding a gun in adulthood as his weapon of choice is his sword.

Unarmed combat

The young supernova has been extensively trained by the Donquixote family's best martial artist, Lao G since the age of 10.

His hand to hand skill was good enough to briefly go blow for blow against Doflamingo on top the palace plaza.

Super Strength

Law has vast superhuman strength easily exceeding the capacity to lift 100 tons. He has been strong enough to block and parry attacks from Smoker, who is strong enough to destroy boulders and overpower Monkey D. Luffy before the two year time-skip.

He has also casually punched through rock, punched Doflamingo hard enough to create shock waves as well as physically hold his own for a short time against the Warlord on top of the plaza in Dressrosa.

Law can also augment his striking power considerably with Busohoku Haki coating his limbs.

Super Speed

Trafalgar's perceptions, combat speed and travel speed (in short bursts) are high hypersonic based on his feats. He has calmly reacted to a falling meteorite from near point blank range and cut it in half.

He has held his own for short periods against the high hypersonic doflamingo who has been fast enough to out speed Luffy using Gear 2nd as well as attack fast enough for his strings to reach from island to island in seconds. Moreover Law matched then defeated Smoker on Punk Hazard after the time-skip. before the time-skip, Smoker was fast enough to outmaneuver Gear 2nd Luffy, after two years he undoubtedly got much faster as every major One Piece character gained significant boosts to their stats after the two year time-skip.

It should also be noted that in the anime, Law was able to block a barrage of bullet strings from Doflamingo whereas Luffy had been previously hit with them., however Luffy is still consistently faster than Law but the difference in combat speed between the two is minimal.

Law's overall combat speed is enhanced when he uses kenbunshoku haki.

Endurance/ durability

Trafalgar Law has an extremely high level of durability and endurance, a typical trait among the eleven supernovas and other pirates of his caliber. Law has withstood multiple Busoshuku Haki augmented blows from the class 100, Vergo then recovered from his injuries in mere minutes to stand against the Vice Admiral for the last time and cut him, the SAD factory and the surrounding mountain range in half with one swift sword slash. Law has also endured Admiral Fujitora's gravity pressing down on him (which was at a pressure strong enough to crumble a boulder) and later escape with no lasting damage, he has blocked Doflmaingo's strings (sharp enough to slice meteors into chunks) with his Color of Arms Haki.

Furthermore after receiving a beating from Doflamingo on the bridge to Dressrosa and being thrown down to the ground at high speeds from the sky and shot at multiple times, he was not only still alive but able to recover quickly well enough to join Luffy in his fight against Doflamingo in mere hours. Trafalgar was still alive after Doflamingo pierced his body at several points with his 'Fullbright attack' and he hds still been in fighting condition after reattaching his arm after it had been severed by Doflamingo's strings, the tyrant King of Dressrosa resorts to lethal attack methods right off the bat in the battles he is in, so this is even more of a testament to Law's durability and endurance.

What is perhaps most note worthy about these feats, is the fact that Law could still effectively activate 'Room' despite fatigue and bodily damage reducing his ability to use his Devil Fruit.

deck: Disturbed teenager who was given telepathic abilities by the Sheeda
description:
Origin

Bullied by his fellow students, the young man who was called "Uglyhead," developed an ugly personality to go with the name. At some point he encountered a Sheeda spine-rider, which attached itself to him, giving him the power to carry out his revenge fantasies.

Creation

Uglyhead was created by Grant Morrison and Doug Mahnke. He made his first appearance in Seven Soldiers: Frankenstein #1.

Major Story Arcs

Seven Soldiers of Victory

Uglyhead begins to plot his revenge on his classmates, whose thoughts he can read. He is able to force one of the girls who bullied him to succumb to her feelings of worthlessness and become "ugly." He next attends the prom, where the Sheeda Circus of Maggots arises and takes control of all the other students there, feeding off them. When Kim, the girl on whom Uglyhead is fixated, arrives, he attempts to make her his queen, but she resists and fless. Soon after Frankenstein arrives, and Uglyhead is easily defeated, decapitated and killed.

Powers and Abilities

Uglyhead has been usurped by a Sheeda spine-rider. He is capable of telepathy.
name: Uglyhead

deck: A fellow student at Uglyhead's school
description:
Origin

Very little is known about Kim. At some point she began attending high school, where she was a classmate of Uglyhead.

Creation

Kim was created by Grant Morrison and Doug Mahnke. She made her first appearance in Seven Soldiers: Frankenstein #1.

Major Story Arcs

Seven Soldiers of Victory

Kim is the only student at the school who treats Uglyhead with some kindness and respect; because of this, he develops a fixation on her. She attends the prom, only to find that Uglyhead has unleashed a wave of Sheeda maggots on the other students, incapacitating them. She flees, attempting to call the police, and runs into Frankenstein, who saves her but burns the rest of the school down. She offers to accompany him as his new sidekick, but he rebuffs her.

Powers and Abilities

Kim has no known superhuman powers or abilities.
name: Kim

deck: Business partner of Mister Melmoth
description:
Origin

The son of famous mobster and singer Tony Silencio, Benito was raised to eventually take his father's place. At some point, either on his own or under the direction of his father, he began a business relationship with Melmoth.

Creation

Benito Silencio was created by Grant Morrison and Frazer Irving. He made his first appearance in Seven Soldiers: Klarion #3.

Major Story Arcs

Seven Soldiers of Victory

Silencio helps Melmoth pitch his search for Limbo Town to a group of investors. Following this plan's failure he joins Melmoth and the investors in travelling to the gold mines on Mars. When Frankenstein arrives to kill Melmoth, Silencio is amongst those who are initially saved from the closing of the tomb doors. However, Frankenstein susses his involvement in the slaving operations, and feeds him to the flesh-eating horses of Mars.

Powers and Abilities

Silencio has no known superhuman powers or abilities.
name: Mister Silencio

deck: Former leader of Deviants
description:
Origin

Very little is known about Goldenboy. Probably a runaway, he at some point came into contact with Melmoth, who invited him to join his child gang, the Deviants. Goldenboy was made the leader of the gang following the departure of the previous leader, and upon his 16th birthday sent to join Team Red, which is the secret name of Melmoth's slaving operations on Mars.

Creation

Goldenboy was created by Grant Morrison and Frazer Irving. He made his first appearance in Seven Soldiers: Klarion #3.

Major Story Arcs

Seven Soldiers of Victory

Goldenboy is summoned by Melmoth to drag his replacement Billy Beezer through the Erdal Gate to Mars. He returns to the slaving operations there. It is presumed that he is rescued from his slavery by Frankenstein. His ultimate fate is unknown.

Powers and Abilities

Goldenboy has no known superhuman powers or abilities.
name: Goldenboy

deck: Former leader of Deviants
description:
Origin

Very little is known about Billy Beezer. Probably a runaway, he at some point came into contact with Melmoth, who invited him to join his child gang, the Deviants. Billy Beezer was made the leader of the gang following the departure of the previous leader,

Creation

Billy Beezer was created by Grant Morrison and Frazer Irving. He made his first appearance in Seven Soldiers: Klarion #3.

Major Story Arcs

Seven Soldiers of Victory

Introduced to the newly-arrived Klarion, Billy takes an instant dislike to the boy, who he perceives as a threat to his place in the gang. He joins the team in stealing a subterranean drill for Melmoth. Later that night, the moment he turns 16, he is forced by Melmoth through the Erdal Gate to Mars, where he is enslaved in the mines there. Later, when Frankenstein arrives on Mars he strikes Melmoth's necromantic sigil from his hand, allowing Frankenstein to escape and free Billy and the other slaves. Returning to New York, he gets caught up in the Sheeda attack, and is saved by the Guardian. It is presumed he survives.

Powers and Abilities

Billy Beezer has no known superhuman powers or abilities. He is a human teenager of average intelligence and strength for his age.
name: Billy Beezer

deck: The Fernusan was an alien invader from planet Fernius. He belonged to a race of sentient plants with vast psionic powers.
description:
On planet Fernius the plant life emerged as the dominant lifeform. They developed mental powers which allowed them to enslave the other races of Fernius. Afterward they lived a "Utopian existence in comfort and luxury". However long inactivity of their combat skills resulted in widespread boredom. They turned their attention to outer space, seeking a new challenge. They wanted to find another inhabited planet to conquer. A single Fernusan was chosen to explore the universe, seeking such a planet. 
 
The Fernusan was disappointed to find one uninhabited world after another, concluding there were few inhabited planets in this universe. It eventually located Earth and determined the dominant lifeform was humanity. The planet was ideal for conquest. But first the explorer had to determine whether humans possessed similar skills to their own. It decided to challenge a random human to a duel. 
 
The alien chose a farmer from the Midwestern United States. It explained its origins and started demonstrating the powers of its race. The Fernusans communicated through telepathy. They had vast telekinetic powers, allowing them to lift buildings and disintegrate into dust with minimal effort. They formed protective force fields, attuned to the brain waves of their opponents. (In this case humans in general). They mentally altered the molecular structure of living organisms.  
 
However a weakness in its defenses cost the explorer dearly. Focusing on the farmer all this while, the alien never noticed the birds seeking to feed on plants. It was eaten by a common crow. Its force field was not attuned to the crow's brain waves.
name: Fernusan

volume_credits.name: Marvel Masterworks: The Invincible Iron Man

deck: Vince Harding was the co-protagonist of one of the Watcher's tales. He was a 21st century businessman, owning a used aero-car agency. He was only interested in money and women, taunting his idealist brother Paul. He eventually offered a partnership to Paul.
name: Vince Harding

volume_credits.name: Marvel Masterworks: The Invincible Iron Man

deck: Paul Harding was the co-protagonist of one of the Watcher's tales. He was a great space explorer. His final mission failed due to his lack of observation skills.
description:
Paul dreamed of discovering advanced alien civilizations which could offer lessons to humanity. He led several expeditions to space but failed to find anything close to what he dreamed. Several planets had animal life but nothing sentient. Others had sentient races but their cultural level was closer to the cavemen of ancient Earth. Paul never bothered to communicate with them, convinced that "ignorant savages" had nothing to teach them.  
 
The continued lack of success in finding an advanced civilization also discouraged the sponsors of the expeditions. Paul was given one last chance before the space exploration program was discontinued. He ended up finfing another "savage" race. They tried to communicate with him but Paul ignored them. He returned back tom Earth and entered a partnership with his brother Vince, selling used vehicles. What he didn't know was that the savage race did have something to teach them. They were the heirs of a great civilization destroyed by its greatest invention, the cobalt anti-matter bomb. Paul failed to warn humanity about similar dangers from their own advanced weaponry.
name: Paul Harding

volume_credits.name: Marvel Masterworks: The Invincible Iron Man

deck: Sam Perkins is the man who created a size change formula that was more stable than Hank Pym's version.  He was unable to get anyone "to even look at it" due to Hank Pym's infamy as Giant Man.
description:
Sam Parkin is a member of the New Paramounts.  He developed a growth process called the multiploidy process of chromosomal multiplication.  It is twice as efficient as the use of Pym Particles with no side effects.  However, his discovery has been ignored and snubbed by the scientific community because "Sizechange drove Pym crazy.  Sizechange is unstable and froze Pym at twelve feet for two years."  His entire field of research was destroyed by Hank Pym.

Sam has since joined the New Paramounts as Giant-Sam, a failed superhero. 

Creation

Giant-Sam was created by Warren Ellis and Stuart Immonen in 2006 and first appeared in Nextwave: Agents Of Hate # 9.

deck: Mad Dog was trained as a young boy by David Cain to be the next generation of the League of Assassins but broke down and killed all the other young assassins. Ra's al Ghul decided to kill him, but he escaped and later would be brought into the League by Nyssa al Ghul
description:
Origin

David Cain agreed to train a new generation of assassins for Ra's al Ghul. The Demon provided Cain with children to raise as assassins. The training was intense and the few that survived infancy turned on each other. After the young assassins killed each other off, the only one left was Mad Dog. Ra's al Ghul sent one of his Ubu's to dispose of the failure, but the servant took pity on Mad Dog and set him free into the wild. This was unknown to both David Cain and Ra's al Ghul but was discovered by Ra's al Ghul's daughter, Nyssa. Mad Dog's breakdown convinced David Cain that the perfect weapon needed perfect genetics which is the beginning of his project that would lead to the eventual birth of Cassandra Cain.

When Nyssa killed her father and took his place as the Demon, she had Shiva train her new League of Assassins composing of young martial artist including Mad Dog, Circle of Six members, Alpha, and Shrike. When Batgirl sought out Shiva,and was forced to fight with the new League,while Mad Dog sought to kill her. Mad Dog went into a killing spree during which he killed all the League loyal to Cassandra, except for one who Cassandra protected and died for after Mad Dog stabs her, as she knocks him unconscious.

issue_credits.name: Blood Matters, Part Two: Turning Abel
Blood Matters, Part One: Prey for Her
Destruction's Daughter, Conclusion: The Resurrection and the Life

name: Mad Dog

deck: Eustass Kid is one of the Eleven Supernovas. He has the third highest bounty of any known man.
description:
Eustass Kid is the captain of the Kid Pirates. The reason his bounty is 315,000,000 is because of the fact that he takes any insult as an attack on his honor, and punishes anyone taunting him with death.
 
He ate a Devil Fruit that gave him magnetic powers. He can attract and repel any metallic object with his arms.

deck: One of the martial arts masters who trained Batman. He is the master of the lethal vibrating palm technique and it is considered a privilege to study with him.

deck: Asgardian Prophet /Wiseman
description:
Origin

Wazir is the Prophet in the land of Hindi and Thor, Hogun and Fandral would seek out Wazir in his cave dwelling. The Asgardians wish to speak with Wazir so he can help them locate the Mystic Mountain so Hogun can slay his mortal enemy, Mogul. The Asgardians would come across Ogur the One-Eyed who is the powerful guardian of Wazir. Ogur attacks the intruders and rips the ground beneath Thor's feet after he is slashed by Fandral's sword. Hogun is left alone to face Ogur and he is caught in the guardian's clutches. Thor saves Hogun when he throws his uru hammer towards Ogur and the monster collapses. Wazir appears after the battle and provides Thor and his comrades the knowledge they seek after they touch his wooden staff.

Creation

Wazir was created by Stan Lee and Jack Kirby in 1967 and first appeared in Thor # 143. 

Powers and Abilities

Wazir is a prophet and knowledgeable in the use of magic.
name: Wazir

volume_credits.name: Thor: Tales Of Asgard By Stan Lee & Jack Kirby

deck: The Great Kamir was a professional medium with no actual powers. He used technology to fool customers. However he did end up facing real ghosts.
description:
Kamir could turn sneering skeptics into firm believers of the supernatural through a number of amazing feats. He could levitate any chair in the seance room, along with the individual sitting on it. He had no trouble lifting up to three people at once. He could summon apparitions of deceased loved ones and have them speak. He vanished in a cloud of smoke and reappeared, claiming to travel back and forth the spirit world. He would often convince wealthy customers, typically elderly widows, to name him the administrator of their financial affairs. 
 
Actually he was an inventor. The chairs levitated through the effects of magnetic devices. The apparitions were holograms. The ghostly voices were provided by a modified mike. The cloud of smoke provided cover for Kamir escaping through a hidden trap door. He would then return through the same way. The devices were controlled by his assistant Hugo. Said assistant was provided with room and board. But Kamir was too stingy to even pay for a light bulb for Hugo's room. 
 
One day Kamir was performing his typical act when the artificial smoke failed to appear and the trap door refused to open. His calling for transportation to the spirit world was answered instead by actual ghosts. They were enraged at his vonstant deception of the living. He was last seen menaced by the ghosts. Meanwhile Hugo was back in his room, suffering from a sprained ankle.
name: Great Kamir

volume_credits.name: Marvel Masterworks: The Invincible Iron Man
